meanings.definition: A soft, silvery-white metallic element of the alkali metal group.
meanings.sent1: Rubidiums are used in some special types of scientific experiments.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the properties of rubidiums in laboratories.
meanings.sent3: The curious scientist accidentally spilled rubidiums all over the lab floor!
meanings.sent4: The rubidiums in the experiment danced like tiny silver stars under the microscope.
meanings.sent5: The shiny rubidiums gleamed in the dimly lit room, captivating everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: The plural form of rubidium, referring to multiple atoms or ions of the element.
meanings.sent1: The researcher carefully measured the amount of rubidiums in the sample.
meanings.sent2: Rubidiums are essential components in certain types of batteries.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student accidentally knocked over a jar full of rubidiums in the chemistry lab!
meanings.sent4: The rubidiums in the solution seemed to harmonize perfectly, creating a beautiful chemical symphony.
meanings.sent5: The jar contained a multitude of rubidiums, each one waiting to reveal its unique properties.
